ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: P: How difficult is it for you to communicate with your child's teacher? T:  How difficult is it for you to communicate with this student's parent?
P: How effective are you at communicating with your child's teacher?  T:  How effective are you at communicating with this student's parent?
P: How confident are you at communicating with your child's teacher? T:  How confident are you at communicating with this student's parent?
P: Does your communication with your child's teacher make a difference in his/her progress? T:  Does your communication with this student's parent make a difference in his/her progress?
P: Are your expectations for communicating with your child's teacher being met? T:  Are your expectations for communicating with this student's parent being met?

Imagine that this ladder represents your communication with this student's parent.  The bottom of the ladder would show the worst communication you could have, and the top of the ladder would show the best communication you could have.  The steps in between are between the best and the worst. If you think about your communication with this student's parent right now, where on the ladder would you place yourself? Mark an X.

Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version
